code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("openwashdata/breathablepitlat") ## Run the following code in console if you don't have the packages ## install.packages(c("dplyr", "knitr", "readr", "stringr", "gt", "kableExtra")) library(dplyr) library(knitr) library(readr) library(stringr) library(gt) library(kableExtra)

title: Dataset about experiments of field application of breathable laminate-lined pit latrines
text: dataset breathablepitlat contains data … 3132 observations 8 variables overview variable names, see following table.

title: Dataset about experiments of field application of breathable laminate-lined pit latrines
text: Geographical location study site. village locates delta area adjacent Ganga River along border Fatehpur District, Uttar Pradesh province, India.
code: library(breathablepitlat) library(tidyverse)  mean_location <- breathablepitlat |>    filter(!str_detect(location, "ined")) |>    filter(num_test=TRUE) |>    group_by(test, site, location) |>   summarize(mean = mean(values, na.rm = TRUE),             std_error = sd(values, na.rm = TRUE) / sqrt(n()),             count=n()             ) # Provide some example code here ggplot(data = mean_location,        mapping = aes(x = site,                      y = mean,                      fill = location)) +   geom_col(position = position_dodge2()) +   facet_wrap(~test, scales = "free")+   theme_minimal() +    labs(title = "Contamination around pit latrines",        subtitle = "Mean of six soil quality tests displayed by site",        x = "Site #",        y = "Mean values",        fill = "Sample location around the pit",        caption = "Data collected from Dec 2021-Dec 2022")+     theme(panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),          panel.grid.major.y = element_blank())

what: breathablepitlat: Field application of breathable laminate-lined pit latrines to capture fecal contamination — breathablepitlat
title: breathablepitlat: Field application of breathable laminate-lined pit latrines to capture fecal contamination — breathablepitlat
text: dataset assists study aims capturing pathogens contaminants pit latrines lining hydrophobic laminate. paper demonstrates transport contaminants two pour flush, twin-pit latrines one pit lined one unlined. direct comparison soil/water quality parameters around pit done elucidate efficacy hydrophobic laminate liner field-scale.

title: breathablepitlat: Field application of breathable laminate-lined pit latrines to capture fecal contamination — breathablepitlat
breathablepitlat: Field application of breathable laminate-lined pit latrines to capture fecal contamination — breathablepitlat
text: tibble 6 rows 8 variables site two sites field test: site 1 site 2. twin-pit pour-flush pit latrine constructed site. depth soil samples collected two different depths (1 m 0.5 m) ground level. lateral soil samples collected 0.5 m , 1 m,  5 m 10 m lateral distance away pit. time describes time (days) sample collection. water soil samples collected period 322 days. test 6 parameters tested samples collected field test. include pH,  electrical conductivity,  total coliform,  nitrate, ammonia,  phosphorus. location location soil samples marked P1 unlined P2 lined pit. , B, C, D, E, F locations around pits M middle point lined unlined pit. values values measured said parameter num_test values measured said parameter
